Revert "[SxS] Flush out metrics for split tab creation"

This reverts commit e4eb581c5cd610ad820587942bc2563211e82874.

Reason for revert: Step "browser_tests (retry shards) on Ubuntu-22.04" failing on builder "chromium/ci/Linux ChromiumOS MSan Tests"

[AriaNotify] Add IA2 fallback for AriaNotify

This change will allow ariaNotify to continue to function on windows
when UIA is disabled by default, or when UIA is disabled to mitigate an
issue on older versions of JAWS, see:
* Jaws bug: crbug.com/406006402
* UIA Enabled by default: crbug.com/40808144
This is largely based on, and reuses some shared code with the fallback
for old linux versions, see: CL:6349538 This change also includes the
fix for the UAF bug that was caused by that original Linux-specific
change.

AX-Relnotes: Adds ariaNotify support for IA2.

device: use new crypto/evp API

This change replaces uses of EVP_marshal_*_key() and EVP_parse_*_key()
with the new utility functions in crypto/evp, which don't require the
caller to construct and manage a CBS or CBB instance to use them. This
shortens the code, removes a couple of error cases, and allows enabling
unsafe buffer protection for some of these files.

Notification: A couple optimizations

- Use transform instead of bounds change during animation for ash.
  Bounds change triggers layout and is expensive, especially for
  complex layout and text heavy UI. Doing it inside animation makes
  it worse. Use transform instead of bounds change when popup
  widgets are not desktop widgets;
- Add `MessagePopupView::GetCachedHeightForWidth` to return last
  calculated height if the requested width and message view state
  is not changed so that text layout is only performed when necessary;
- Use range based loop in `CalculateAndUpdateBounds` to be more
  efficient.

[Masonry] ComputeAutomaticRepetitions

Compute the correct number of automatic repetitions for masonry in the
grid axis, which is essentially the same as that of grid's
implementation (CL:2606026), modulo lack for subgrid support.

This involved:

1. Tracking `masonry_available_size_`,`masonry_min_available_size_`, and
`masonry_max_available_size_` within the masonry layout algo.

2. Compute these values on masonry layout algorithm construction. This
involved moving common code with Grid to a new grid_layout_utils file.

3. Move common code for ComputeAutomaticRepetitions from Grid to the new
utils file.

4. Call into the new helper for calculating automatic repetitions in
masonry.

Note that there are a few test failures. These are unrelated to
automatic repetition calculations, but rather existing sizing bugs (I
believe there are overlaps with some of the other failing tests we've
seen in the external/wpt/css/css-grid/masonry/tentative folder).

Revert "[A11yPerformance] Use AXBitset for bool attributes in AXNodeData"

This reverts commit f697c0257aed084a7a892c37690e5ab85f673b87.

Reason for revert: Original change caused performance regressions 
https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/426648855

Original change's description:
> [A11yPerformance] Use AXBitset for bool attributes in AXNodeData
>
> Save boolean attributes in AXNodeDate with an AXBitset instead of a
> vector. This is more performant and has a smaller footprint.
>
> For serialization, the bool_attributes getter in StructTraits iterates
> through the set attributes. If an attribute is set, it's added to the
> std::map that is returned for Mojo serialization.
>
> For deserialization, the Read method in StructTraits iterates over the
> BoolAttribute map, populating entries in the AXBitset in the C++
> AXNodeData object.
>
> The choice between AXBitset and the existing std::vector implementation
> is controlled with the feature flag kAccessibilityUseAXBitset and
> std::variant.
>

Update layer type used for the client view of a BubbleDialog

Currently the client view of BubbleDialog always paints to a textured
layer, however, implementations can specify the layer type of the
widget's layer.

So we can have NOT_DRAWN_LAYER for the widget but have a TEXTURED_LAYER
for the client view. This is unwanted because if the widget has a
NOT_DRAWN_LAYER, we expect the bubble to act as a transparent container.
Therefore it is unnecessary for client view to have a textured layer.

A NOT_DRAWN_LAYER is enough for the clipping purposes.

This CL updates the patter to configure the layer type from overriding a
method to having a setter method.

[Multiple Requests] Integrate with virtual card enrollment flow (4)

Have CCAM call VCEM to get enroll details the same time it is
unmasked. No change for Upstream enrollment or Settings page enrollment.

For Downstream enrollment, flow will be (assume exp enabled):

1) Card is to be unmasked, and before sending unmask request, if card is
eligible for VCN, send the InitVirtualCardEnroll call with no callback.

2) When form is submitted and a matched server card is extracted, invoke
the second InitVirtualCardEnroll, this time with same info but with a
callback to trigger the UI.

2.1) if response has been received at this time, invoke the callback
immediately to show the UI (virtual card enroll bubble/bottomsheet).

2.2) if response is not yet received from the server, assign the
callback, and OnDidGetDetailsForEnrollResponse will show the UI when
response is received.

[Settings][DBD] Fix subpage linkrows border-radius logic

Using existing CSS selectors like nth-child or nth-of-type does not work
given the dynamic visibility and different elements being used for the
linkout rows in the 'Other google data' subpage.

nth-of-type targets elements of the same type.

nth-child targets any elements in the dom, however, given that the
elements are shown conditionally, wrapping them in a dom-if template
(with restamp) still leaves behind an element with `display: none` which
the selector would interpret as a child.

This change determines the appropriate CSS class programmatically
instead depending on the visibility of the linkouts.

Add new extension platform "desktop_android" to json schema compiler

This allows files like _api_features.json to explicitly list (or
explicitly *not* list) desktop_android support.

Once we update api_features and permissions_features we'll be able
to prevent CHECK failures in the renderer when extensions try
to call APIs that haven't been ported to desktop Android yet.

[Watermark 2.0] Fix incorrect check for watermark command-line flags

The logic to check if the current channel is not STABLE or BETA was
incorrect. It used an || (OR) operator which would always evaluate to
true, meaning the command-line flags for watermark opacity were always
being checked, regardless of the channel.

This change corrects the logic to use && (AND), so the flags are only
checked on non-stable and non-beta channels as intended.

  //chrome/browser/tab_group_suggestion:java ->
  //chrome/browser/ui/android/toolbar:java ->

	library to prevent said cyclic dependency

Add AutoPictureInPictureTabModelObserverHelper implementations

Key changes:
- The helper observes TabModelList and the specific TabModel containing
the WebContents. It fires a callback whenever the tab's activation
state changes.
- Core logic is centralized in ReevaluateObservedModelAndState, which is
triggered by events like tab selection, removal, or model changes
(e.g., moving a tab to another window).
- Tests covering tab switching, multi-window management, and the
observer's lifecycle.

ozone/drm: Disable all CRTCs/connectors for tiled controller

Currently, ScreenManager::RemoveDisplayControllers() removes a
HardwareDisplayController from its mapping when a single CRTC is
removed from a HDC. In the tiled display case when multiple
CRTC/Connector pairs  may exist in a HDC, some enabled pairings may not
be disabled due to the HDC being removed so early.

This CL ensures that all CRTCs/controllers in a tiled HDC are part of
the disable commit request. Removing a tiled HDC like this is OK (and
even preferable) vs waiting for all CRTC/connectors to be removed, as
DrmGpuDisplayManager is going to create a new DrmDisplay and HDC if
there's a remaining tiled connector anyways; not erasing it just causes
confusion and the screen to freeze in occasion due to mismatched
controller mapping.

Renderer navigation timeline part 2: add renderer-side traces and metrics

This CL uses the navigation_metrics_token introduced in
https://crrev.com/c/6514188 to record a new set of renderer-centric
navigation trace events, representing a timeline of how the
destination renderer process handles a navigation, starting from
process startup and progressing through view creation, proxy creation,
provisional frame creation, and finally CommitNavigation. The
browser-to-renderer IPCs used in this CL to create the new timeline
are CreateView, CreateRemoteChildren, CreateFrame, and
CommitNavigation. Note that no timelines are shown for other renderer
processes involved in the navigation, including the initiator process
or intermediate processes if a redirect occurs.

The approach is to introduce a new renderer-global
RendererNavigationMetricsManager object which keeps a map from
navigation metrics tokens to a per-navigation timeline object that
keeps timestamps for events pertaining to that navigation. Note that
there could be multiple CreateView and CreateRemoteChildren IPCs per
navigation, for example when setting up proxies in multiple pages on
the navigating frame's opener chain. Hence, there is a list of
begin/end timestamps for these IPCs, rather than a single pair. Once a
navigation finishes processing CommitNavigation (or its variants
CommitFailedNavigation/CommitSameDocumentNavigation), the
RendererNavigationMetricsManager is given a signal to record the
timeline, and it does this following precedent set in
https://crrev.com/c/6092101.

Handling aborted or canceled navigations is fairly complex. Ideally,
we'd clean up a navigation's timestamps when its NavigationClient
interface gets disconnected (which is how the renderer knows that
navigations are aborted), but sadly the frame/view/proxy creation IPCs
are not sent via NavigationClient and moreover, they are sent before
the NavigationClient is even set up in some cases (e.g.,
cross-process, browser-initiated navigations). Changing
NavigationClient to be set up sooner might work as a longer-term
solution, but would face its own challenges, since it's current
lifetime is tied to web compatibility, by defining when a
renderer-initiated navigation may be canceled via JS (see comments on
RenderFrameImpl::navigation_client_impl_). In the short term, this CL
takes a simple best-effort approach of cleaning up a navigation's
timestamps if the navigation hasn't committed after a timeout of 5
minutes (note that this covers at least 99.99%+ of navigations as
measured by Navigation.StartToCommit, which is capped at 3 minutes).

Due to https://crbug.com/405437928, overlapping navigations may not
show up properly nested; this will be investigated and fixed
separately, both for the existing browser timeline events and this
CL's renderer timeline events.

See the "Renderer-centric track" proposal in
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WUTAA9mbsr__prHyYPFPWKqNQpX0x7HVjoYvqt_n_q0/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.p50kjlrjeqlr
for more information.

This CL is not meant to be exhaustive but rather to introduce a
foundation with core trace events. Events for processing other IPCs
pertaining to navigations might be added to this timeline in the
future. Also, one known limitation is that renderer-initiated
same-document and synchronous about:blank navigations currently don't
show up on the renderer timeline, as they involve no IPCs from the
browser at all.

Sample traces:

NavigateABCToABD test:
https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=15ba048cb3d634da74323b39ad6a15a68d0beda1

Beforeunload handling in
RenderFrameHostImplWithOrWithoutLegacyBeforeUnloadBrowserTest.BeforeUnloadDialogInOOPIF:
https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=08f9af60c67258767dcf518955d7bdeec0ed86d6

Opener chains in PostMessageWithSubframeOnOpenerChain:
https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=e041901eb98b96d74f082a5944b597c186a75085
E.g., the last baz.com navigation has a length-2 opener chain and
creates three views: one for opener.opener, one for opener, and one
for itself.

Remote-to-local navigation in
SitePerProcessScrollAnchorTest.RemoteToLocalScrollAnchorRestore:
https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=5ce029b799ab6b34365e22128140d0700f7964aa
(The last navigation is remote-to-local and starts with CreateFrame
rather than CreateView.)

Browser-initiated same-document navigation in
NavigationBrowserTest.SameDocumentNavigation:
https://ui.perfetto.dev/#!/?s=39371e6b5b7c5f44dabdeb02986f8d46e121732d
(Second navigation is same-document and an example of how the commit
IPC is the navigation's first IPC, and no frames/views/proxies are
created.)

Mitigate web-transport throttling based on the end-point's IP

This CL changes the HTTP3 WebTransport client to pass the server's IP
in case of failure during the handshake negotiation, as described in
the design document [1].

A new method is added to the WebTransport mojom interface of the
Network Service to pass a IPEndPoint instance to the browser process
before the UDP connection is created.

The blink's implementation of this interface will send an invalid
IPEndPoint instance to avoid handling sensitive information in the
renderer process.

The WebTransportThrottling class will receive the IPEndPoint instance
in the new argument of the Tracker::InHandshakeFailed function; it will
be used then to compute the appropriate penalty. A new method is added
specifically for this purpose.

[1]https://docs.google.com/document/d/1j2NJqLQyAHSBZArW6Iwg8uVId3NGQxnBV7b9LYbd8FM/edit#heading=h.numlu03ovx44

[WebInstallAPI] Add custom WebAppFilter for background app launches

When navigator.install is invoked for a background app, we first check
if it's already installed. This change adds a new WebAppFilter so we
only consider apps to launch that were installed by the user and will
launch in a standalone window. This effectively excludes things like
preinstalled apps, policy apps, IWAs, system apps, sub apps, and kiosk
apps

If an app that fails the Filter is present in the registrar, it will go
through the install flow and essentially get reinstalled as a regular
standalone app. Add a parameterized test for these cases.

Misc bug #418618958 - add test coverage `InstallApp_FromPWAWindow`

Revert "Remove OWNERS mentioning elainechien@"

This reverts commit 532e86c9db352e9368c879d62464dd5f3041af2d.

Reason for revert: Removing owners is the incorrect way to deal with leaves. Please escalate up if this is an issue. This CL was not topical in that removing elainechien@ also removed other owners, which was the real impact.

Original change's description:
> Remove OWNERS mentioning elainechien@
>
> Elaine no longer works on Chromium.
>
> Additionally, several OWNERS files mentioning her are co-owned with
> kylixrd@, who is actually on extended leave and not currently reviewing
> CLs at all (e-mail him internally to see the auto-response). These
> directories are nominally single-owner and effectively zero-owner
> (except `ui/base/metadata/OWNERS`).
>
> Remove the OWNERS files in question, letting ownership flow upward.
>

Bug: 424412649
Change-Id: Ie8d8950074e47af7986394ce3c077ca54ec7298a
Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6652383
Reviewed-by: Calder Kitagawa <ckitagawa@chromium.org>
Commit-Queue: Brandon Fong <bjfong@google.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477496}

Cache an HMONITOR in each ScreenWinDisplay to optimize display lookups

This optimization is behind two flags that must both be enabled:
base::features::kReducePPMs flag which groups several performance
optimizations to measure their combined impact, and
display::features::kScreenWinDisplayLookupByHMONITOR which can be used
as an independent killswitch.

The flags change the implementation of display lookups:

 * Both enabled:
   [HWND, Rect, Point] -> HMONITOR Keyed Lookup
 * Either disabled (status quo):
   [HWND, Rect, Point] -> HMONITOR -> MONITORINFOEX -> ID lookup

ScreenWin::GetScreenDisplayVia is causing about 2.6% of all Chrome jank
on Windows, almost all of it in MonitorInfoFromHMONITOR and
DisplayIdFromMonitorInfo. (See http://screen/7m4rm7HhnYg5fgR.png .) This
is because GetScreenWinDisplayVia needs to convert an HMONITOR to
MONITORINFOEX, and then to a stable display ID, in order to look up the
ScreenWinDisplay by ID. The conversion has a lot of overhead and happens
very often.

According to
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/gdi/hmonitor-and-the-device-context,
"A physical display has the same HMONITOR as long as it is part of the
desktop. When a WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent, any monitor may be
removed from the desktop and thus its HMONITOR becomes invalid or has
its settings changed." So the mapping of HMONITOR to ScreenWinDisplay
should only change at WM_DISPLAYCHANGE.

This adds an optional<HMONITOR> to ScreenWinDisplay, which is set to
nullopt on WM_DISPLAYCHANGE. (And initialized to nullopt for displays
that never had an HMONITOR, such as on headless.) In practice the list
of displays is regenerated with UpdateAllDisplaysAndNotify() after
WM_DISPLAYCHANGE, which assigns new HMONITOR's to each display, but if
any display remains in the list without a new HMONITOR its stale value
is cleared.

With the optimization enabled GetScreenDisplayVia looks up the
ScreenDisplayWin by HMONITOR and falls back to the
HMONITOR->MONITORINFOEX->stable ID slow path if none is found.

Note that ScreenWinHeadless doesn't use HMONITOR at all, so must still
look up ScreenDisplayWin by converting MONITORINFOEX to stable ID. This
is fast because ScreenWinHeadless uses synthesized display ID's,
avoiding the overhead of looking up HMONITOR properties.

Several new ScreenWin methods are made virtual, so that they can be
overridden in tests and for headless:

 * HMONITORFrom[ScreenPoint|ScreenRect|Window]: New methods, analogues
   of MonitorInfoFrom[ScreenPoint|ScreenRect|Window]. Overridden in
   tests to return fake HMONITORs, and in ScreenWinHeadless to do
   nothing.
 * MonitorInfoFromHMONITOR: Formerly a private function. Overridden in
   tests to map fake HMONITORs to monitor info, and in
   ScreenWinHeadless to do nothing.
 * MonitorInfoFrom[ScreenPoint|ScreenRect|Window]: Formerly overridden
   in tests and in ScreenWinHeadless. Now only overridden in
   ScreenWinHeadless. Tests use the production implementations, which
   call their overridden HMONITORFrom* and MonitorInfoFromHMONITOR.
 * GetScreenWinDisplayNearestScreen[Rect|Point]: Formerly non-virtual.
   Overridden in ScreenWinHeadless to skip the HMONITOR lookup.
   (For some reason GetScreenWinDisplayNearestHWND already had an
   override in ScreenWinHeadless.)
 * GetScreenWinDisplayForHMONITOR: New method that does the HMONITOR
   lookup. Overridden in ScreenWinHeadless to do nothing.

NTP promos: Add controller

This is the core piece on the browser side of the NTP promo system. As
of now, the controller handles only a subset of its planned
capabilities, namely:

- It returns promos directly from the associated registry, with an
  initial eligibility filter, but no ordering logic beyond that.
- Eligibility logic may move out to a separate module, but it's not
  particularly complex, so it may live in the controller indefinitely.
- Click handling, to invoke the registered action.

android: suppress FlaggedApi lint.

The Android linter's FlaggedApi check currently has issues accurately
reporting on which calls need to be flagged - it mishandles APIs that
are being deprecated under a flag or that have already been released
but are still marked as flagged in the metadata. This is only an issue
when compiling with the internal SDK snapshot which has this flagging
metadata included.

Until the underlying issues with the linter are resolved, suppress all
FlaggedApi lints for upstream code, which isn't likely to reference
genuinely-flagged APIs anyway.

using devices with Demo Accounts on retail stores, we need to display a

Legal team.

[ProtoExtras] Add support for the equality operator (==)

This adds generation of C++ `operator==`, allowing faster comparison of
protobuf messages than always serializing both to a string.

The implementation uses reflection to compare all fields, and includes
support for delegating this functionality to MessageDifferencer for
builds that use protobuf_full.

Changes to how BubbleDialogDelegate deals with contents with a layer

1. Get rid of `set_force_create_contents_background()`: This setter was
adding as to fix the missing BubbleBorderBackground for TrayBubbleView.
The widget associated with TrayBubbleView has a NOT_DRAWN_LAYER.
Therefore, the BubbleFrameView (NonClientFrameView) is never painted.
Additionally, TrayBubbleView (content's view) has a non-opaque layer, so
we were not setting a background in
`BubbleDialogDelegate::UpdateFrameColor()`.

Therefore `set_force_create_contents_background()` was added to force a
background in `BubbleDialogDelegate::UpdateFrameColor()`.

Instead of having this exception, the TrayBubbleView should set its own
background.

2. Get rid of of background BubbleDialogDelegate::UpdateFrameColor(): If
the contents view painted to an opaque layer, the bubble border
background will not show through. (See b:41285108) To fix it, a
background with bubble color was painted to content's view. This is a
bit hacky and unexpected behavior for the client. If the content's view
decides to paint on an opaque layer, the clients should be responsible
to paint all the pixels of the layer.

Prevent use-after-free by binding button callbacks with WeakPtr

This change resolves an intermittent use-after-free crash on macOS that
occurred when the UB bubble was destroyed during a page reload.

This crash was caused by a race condition where a stray event was
triggering the TP button's callback after the view controller had been
deleted by the navigation cleanup logic. The callbacks were bound with
base::Unretained, leading to a crash when executed on the dangling
pointer.

I've updated all the callbacks in this function to use WeakPtrs to
prevent this from happening to their callbacks.

Hook up bypass reports for MaliciousApkDownloadWarning

This CL hooks up a new type of ClientSafeBrowsingReportRequest,
DANGEROUS_DOWNLOAD_WARNING_ANDROID, and sends a report when the user
bypasses a MaliciousApkDownloadWarning dialog from Chrome's Download
Home UI.

On Android, these reports do not populate DownloadWarningActions yet.

Heed (did_proceed==false) reports are also not yet hooked up yet.

[bedrock] Synchronously close SendTabToSelfToolbarBubbleController

SendTabToSelfToolbarBubbleController currently creates a bubble
that holds references to the Browser hosting the controller. Under
the new proposed CLIENT_OWNS_WIDGET Browser ownership scheme it may
be possible to outlive the controller's bubble Widget (which is
currently closed and destroyed asynchronously).

This CL synchronously closes the controller's bubble on destruction
to mitigate the risk of dangling references.

Remove nacl output binaries from linux-chromeos archive config

The bot very likely stopped building these binaries after nacl
deprecation in https://crrev.com/c/6632728. But it was continuing
to upload the binaries from prev builds since the bot doesn't clobber.
So this removes nacl binaries from its archive config, and makes the
bot clobber since that would have made this error immediate. All
other archive bots clobber (likely for the same reason), and it's
unclear why this one doesn't.

[webview][prefetch] Add Tests for Prefetch Interactions with
shouldInterceptRequest()

This CL adds tests for prefetch interactions with
`shouldInterceptRequest()`. Specifically it asserts the following:

1. That prefetches that are initiated by the renderer (i.e. prefetches associated with a web contents) call the
`WebViewClient#shouldInterceptRequest()` callback.

2. That prefetches that are embedder initiated (e.g. browser context
prefetch requests) do not call the
`WebViewClient#shouldInterceptRequest()` callback.

The next steps from here are to update the public documentation
around both `WebViewClient#shouldInterceptRequest()` and
`Profile.prefetchUrlAsync()` to reflect this behavior.

[TreesInViz] Plumb IsDirectlyCompositedImage and nearest_neighbor to Viz.

This change plumbs |IsDirectlyCompositedImage()| and |nearest_neighbor()|
from PictureLayerImpl to TileDisplayLayerImpl, and updates the logic in
|TileDisplayLayerImpl::AppendQuads()| to match what existed before the
change to use mojom for display tree construction.

When using directly composited images, we must set |shared_quad_state->clip_rect|
to the intersection of the bounds of the layer and any existing clip. This is
required because in these cases, the tiling can have fractional dimensions due to
the fact that raster scale is not applied to both dimensions equally, when the
aspect ratio of the layer does not match that of the image.

This change also ensures that the nearest_neighbor property of directly
composited image layers is correctly propagated to quads.

tabs_api: add basic Tab Group support

This CL adds basic Tab Group support to TabStripAPI.

2 new events are added:
- OnTabGroupCreated(OnTabGroupCreatedEvent event)
  fired when a new tab group has been created.
- OnTabGroupVisualsChanged(OnTabGroupVisualsChangedEvent event)
  fired when a tab group's visuals have been changed.

The Position struct is augmented with an optional NodeId field, so it
can be used to indicate the movement of a tab from one collection to
another.

When the tab group is opened, an OnTabGroupCreated event is fired first,
then comes an OnTabGroupVisualsChanged event and several OnTabMoved
events for each tab in that group.

The demo shows opening a saved tab group from the bookmark bar,
screencast:
https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDk1NTk4NDA0MzcwNDMyMHw5ZThhOGZjZS1kMQ

This CL does not contain any tests. Will add them later.

[soft navs] Fix crash in ReportSoftNavigationToMetrics() due to Detach

When timestamps are coarsened, paint timings are flushed in a delayed
task scheduled from presentation time callback. But this delayed task
does not check if the page is detached before running (whereas the
initial callback does). Therefore it's possible for the frame to be
detached in ReportSoftNavigationToMetrics(), which causes a crash
because we've already cleared the set of potential soft nav contexts
before CHECKing the FCP context belongs to this SNH.

To fix this, this CL reorders the existing checks: return if detached
before checking EnsureContextForCurrentWindow(). As a follow-up in
M140, I'll change PaintTiming to not dispatch these callbacks and
change this to a CHECK(not-detached).

WebDriver mode that was added to the SPC spec in

Fold text-line variant of GraphicsContext::DrawLine() and simplify

The only caller of GraphicsContext::DrawLine() that set the is_text_line
parameter to true is the DecorationPainter helper DrawLineAsStroke().
Fold DrawLine(..., is_text_line=true, ...) into that helper and then
simplify the result. All lines are horizontal and the adjustments that
are based stroke-style can be simplified. This will make it easier to
see what the paint code-path of certain stroke-style decorations does,
and keep it in sync with the code for bounds computation.

Clean up GraphicsContext::DrawLine() now that the is_text_line parameter
can be removed. The cc::PaintFlags parameters is also unused (always
nullptr) so it can be dropped as well. Fold the
AdjustLineToPixelBoundaries() helper and re-order the code a bit to
avoid going back and forth between integers and floats unnecessarily.

WebAuthn: Route getCredentials to the cache when necessary

Passkey Cache is available starting GMSCore y2024w44 and is faster
compared to the current FIDO2 getCredentials. Chrome will use it when
possible.
- It will not be used if the request is for a payment request.
- It will not be used if the request has google.com as the RP ID.
- It will not be used for pre-CredMan non-discoverable credential check.
- It will not be used getMatchingCredentialIds requests. These are also
 for payments.

With this change the CredentialFetchDuration reporting is also moved to
GetCredentialsHelper.

NO_IFTTT=Newly introduced IFTTT block

Factor out DecorationGeometry from TextDecorationInfo::LineData

Rename TextDecorationInfo::LineData to DecorationGeometry and move it to
beside DecorationLinePainter, and have it act as the main data source
for painting decoration lines. The coupling to TextDecorationInfo will
be further reduced in follow up CLs.

Add DecorationGeometry::Make() and call that from
TextDecorationInfo::SetLineData() when resolving the decoration
geometry. Fold some more code that is only needed for the geometry setup
into that function, such as ShouldAntialias() and DecorationStyle().

Relocate wavy-related code to an anonymous namespace in
decoration_line_painter.cc with minimal changes. ComputeWavyLineData()
need to take a WavyParams and a DecorationGeometry object to populate.

Drop the DrawLineForText() overload that is no longer needed, and call
DrawLineAsRect() directly when drawing "double" lines.

[animation-trigger] Use consistent pixel spaces

The animation trigger code stored ranges created by script in CSS
pixels and ranges created by CSS in physical pixels. It also wrongly
mixed pixel spaces when evaluating whether a scroll offset was within
the trigger range.

This patch fixes this by ensuring that
AnimationTrigger::{exit}range{Start,End} is consistently stored in CSS
pixels and handles the conversion between CSS pixels and physical
pixels when evaluating a given scroll offset.

Implement rate_limiting_key for Android download protection

This adds a new proto field, rate_limiting_key, to the
ClientDownloadRequests sent by Chrome on Android. This key is a
pseudonymous identifier that rotates every 15 minutes and differs for
each Chrome profile on the device. This key is meant to be used by the
server to rate-limit or throttle individual clients who are sending too
many requests.

[soft navs] Optimize SoftNavigationHeuristics::EnsureContextForCurrentWindow

This method is on a potentially hot path (ModifiedDOM w/ a context), so
it needs to be fast. It's currently O(# tracked contexts), because the
set of tracked contexts is a Vector, and we need to call Contains.

This CL changes potential_soft_navigations_ (back) to a HashSet. We
could alternatively store (weakly) the SoftNavigationHeuristics on the
SoftNavigationContext (even cheaper), but that's a larger change, and we
still currently need the set for other reasons. If we find we need the
SNH on the context for other reasons, we can revisit.

Note: this also changes iteration order, but the order doesn't matter
for the reasons we're iterating.

Initial parsing+storage of border-shape

Setup the runtime flags and basic parsing.
Not overdoing it with parsing tests yet, as the syntax might change,
and the first objective is to prototype something demo-able.

Parsing two basic shapes and storing as 0-2 BasicShapes in a new
StyleBorderShape class.

Note that the single-shape variant is equivalent to the two-shape
variant when the two shapes are identical. This makes animating
between the two variants possible. The details of this will be fleshed
out at CSSWG after prototyping.

Chrome Status: https://chromestatus.com/feature/5459864205393920

Explainer: https://github.com/noamr/explainers/blob/main/border-shape-explainer.md
Spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-borders-4/#border-shape

waffle: Wipe choice prefs on inconsistent DSE absence

The presence of DSE choice metadata implies that a DSE choice was made,
and in this case we also expect a DSE to be set in prefs. There are some
flows that can cause the DSE pref to be cleared, like pref tampering
detection. When this happens, we also wipe the DSE choice metadata to
trigger a new choice prompt.

This new behaviour is added behind the
WipeChoicePrefsOnMissingDefaultSearchEngine feature flag.

[ProtoExtras] Separate functionality into different headers.

This CL significantly changes the behavior of the proto_extras gni
template to generate one proto_library per functionality, instead of
having all generated functionality exist in one header. Furthermore,
each functionality only depends on the specific dependencies it needs.

The previous behavior was that a single file would be generated
(.extras.h/cc) which would contain all of the possible functionality,
depending on the set options, and depend on all dependency "extras"
targets fully.

Now:
1. Serialize is now in <name>.to_value.h/cc
2. Streaming operators are now in <name>.ostream.h/cc
3. The `extras_deps` field is added, used to pass the proto_extras
   target for any dependency protobuf targets.

This change is necessary to:
- Allow code to only include support for a single functionality it
  needs, instead of all functionality, decreasing build & link times.
- Address feedback about how having a lot of functionality in one
  "utils" or "extras" header can cause scope bloat and dependency
  issues.
- Allow the build graph to minimize more per-extras-functionality.

[Bookmarks Bar] Add layout change listener to BookmarkBarCoordinator

This CL updates the Bookmark Bar implementation for listening to changes
in height and calling provided callbacks.

With this CL we remove some ObservableSuppliers and the need to pass
down to the BookmarkBar view the callbacks for changes in heights. The
clients of the ObserverableSuppliers were not adding themselves as
observers, and instead using them as simple Suppliers, so we have
updated those instances. The Coordinator has access to the view and
so it can listen to layout changes and call the one callback needed on
each change directly. This simplifies the code and gives every client
the true height of the view without layers of abstraction.

Remove setNoticeShown for PS notices

This CL removes the setting of notice shown

After some manual testing, it seems noticeShown is persisting across
sessions. A session is not tied to each browser process; it could span
multiple processes. With the queueing system, when a notice is shown
once, we don't show it for the rest of the session. This is unexpected
behavior, as do in fact want to show it on browser process start/stop, which can happen multiple times within a session.

Previous related CL:
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6499207

[Uno-D] Add Batch Upload entry point to Profile Menu

The batch upload entry point in the Profile Menu should have Promo-
like appearance, which already exists with the changes made around
HistorySyncOptin.

In this change, we extract the logic, of create promo buttons in the
Profile Menu, into its own component. The Ui presentation of those
buttons - having backgrounds and corner edges - is slightly special.
The first promo should have its upper corners rounded, and the last
promo should have its lower corners rounded. For a single promo that
is the same button having all corners rounded.

There is also a limit of two promos to be shown at most, this is a
Ui/Ux decision, so that the promo are not too overwhelming. Currently,
there is no more than two promos to be shown, however if in a later
stage that evolves, a more complex logic would be needed to determine
which promo would have priority.

Screenshots:
Single promo: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BNwe9NhAUDzUbZP
Two promos: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7kjo44iAJPfMALT
Mock single promo: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/rqkHg3wicds3ra7
Mock two promos: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/625czR8JSc49FVn

(Re)load search results when safe-search is forced by content filters

Extends the navigation observer with a feature that reacts to search
content filters changes. In order to accommodate the feature, the
Supervised User Service changes its api to accept factories of "content
filter observers" (which now are an obligatory argument, yielding some
extra changes in this changeset).

Android browser-test verifies both if the page is reloaded when safe
search content filters change are enabled, or if simply search results
are loaded when the filter is on.

In order to accommodate testing, the navigation observer must handle the
lifecycle of the supervised user service (further improvements are
backlogged).

Fix border drawing for corners that touch each other

The original logic was trying to not draw overlapping sides,
by checking if the rect occupied by two adjacent sides intersect each other.

However, this was missing cases where the corner had zero or empty radius and would still intersect
with the opposite corner.

This CL checks for cases where the edge intersects with the unadjusted corner point as well.

[webview][prefetch] Introduce WebViewPrefetchHighestPrefetchPriority

This introduces the feature `WebViewPrefetchHighestPrefetchPriority`
that sets the highest priority for WebView Prefetch. Since WebView
Prefetch is triggered from the app hosting the WebView by its own
decision and responsibility, it can be reasonable to have a higher
priority.

Please see
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ifwra6N4URhs4yD3FS_AOuzB12rZGhfuphvRd2_wuzE/edit?disco=AAABkjAa7-E
for more details.

Refactor HttpStreamPool::JobController to consolidate session reuse logic

This CL refactors HttpStreamPool::JobController::HandleStreamRequest()
to improve code organization by extracting the logic for checking
existing sessions/streams into a new method
MaybeCreateStreamFromExistingSession().

The refactoring:
- Introduces a new struct to bundle HttpStream with its negotiated
  protocol.
- Reduces code duplication in HandleStreamRequest() by having a single
  callback invocation point for all existing session types.

No functional changes.

Fix token pasting with empty fallbacks.

When deciding whether we'd need to insert a dummy comment between
two tokens in CSS token pasting, an empty fallback could confuse
the logic, in that we thought we inserted an EOF token.

Fix by having an early return from empty fallbacks; they shouldn't
affect the output in any reasonable way.

[ReduceScreenSize] Add a flag to enable the feature in Incognito.

This CL adds a feature flag to //chrome which, when enabled, will
enable the Blink-side runtime-enabled flag. This //chrome feature
is routed to Blink as a new WebPreference, and enables the
Blink-side flag when initializing the relevant `blink::WebView` in
`WebView::ApplyWebPreferences(...)`.

[ReduceScreenSize] Rename `AddPageEmbeddedPermissionObserver`.

Now that it's used for something other than `<permission>`, the name
ought to be a little broader. This is a purely mechanical rename:

git grep -n -l -e "AddPageEmbeddedPermissionObserver" | xargs -L1 \
    sed -i '' -e 's/AddPageEmbeddedPermissionObserver/AddCombinedPermissionObserver/g'

[Autofill] Remove `*_TAG` types from AttributeType::field_type()

This CL removes `{DRIVERS_LICENSE,PASSPORT_NAME,VEHICLE_OWNER}_TAG`
from AttributeType::field_type(). The change is behind the feature
kAutofillAiNoTagTypes.

The change is complicated by the fact that features cannot be checked
in constexpr functions. The CL therefore introduced constexpr
AttributeType::field_type_with[out]_tag_types() and delegates the
responsibility to pick the right one to the caller.

[Autofill] Remove Autofill AI FieldType check in GetSuggestions()

This CL removes an early return if the focused field has no Autofill AI
type before calling CreateFillingSuggestions().

Removing the early return is safe because if the focused field has no
assigned AttributeType, CreateFillingSuggestions() returns the empty
vector, just as the early return does.

[Autofill] Dynamically assign types in DetermineAttributeTypes()

This CL implements the dynamic type assignment of former `*_TAG`
types in DetermineAttributeTypes().

Type assignment proceeds in two phases: static and dynamic type
assignment. Dynamic type assignment propagates the static types
to fields.

Currently, only name fields are possible targets of propagation.
More generally, fields whose FieldType is contained in more than
one AttributeType's field_subtypes() are possible targets.

Revert "Handle owned frame buffers when zero-copy is enabled in MFVEA"

This reverts commit 7301e6efe7a05aa2a25d24626d62d0a27a2f32af.

Reason for revert:
LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5839715321249792

Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8711499726065026481
Affected test(s):
[ninja://third_party/blink/renderer/platform:blink_platform_unittests/RTCVideoEncoderEncodeTest.NoSoftwareFallbackOnMappableNativeInput](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fthird_party%2Fblink%2Frenderer%2Fplatform:blink_platform_unittests%2FRTCVideoEncoderEncodeTest.NoSoftwareFallbackOnMappableNativeInput?q=VHash%3Ae647c1a343e3c4c1)

If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5839715321249792&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F6652166&type=BUG

Original change's description:
> Handle owned frame buffers when zero-copy is enabled in MFVEA
>
> When a frame with an owned native storage type is passed to MFVEA which
> is backed up by a GPU buffer, the encoder falls back to software
> implementation. This fix converts input frame to non-native buffer type
> suitable for MFVEA processing.

Prefetch: Derive net::RequestPriority from PrefetchPriority

If the prefetch caller expects to need prefetch resources to be
available sooner, we can give higher `net::RequestPriority` so that
their network request can be prioritized in //net layer.

Please see
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ifwra6N4URhs4yD3FS_AOuzB12rZGhfuphvRd2_wuzE/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.742ztsc9wg3h
for more detailed mappings discussion between `PrefetchPriority` and
`net::RequestPriority` for the future. Currently `net::RequestPriority`
is calculated from `PrefetchType`, but it can eventually derived from
`PrefetchPriority`.

There is no behavior change in this CL, since
`PrefetchContainer::priority_` is always `std::nullopt` for now.

Prefetch: Derive PrefetchSchedulerPriority from PrefetchPriority

We can derive `PrefetchSchedulerPriority` from `PrefetchPriority` -- If
the prefetch caller expects to need prefetch resources to be available
sooner, we can set higher `PrefetchSchedulerPriority` to prioritize it.

Please see
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ifwra6N4URhs4yD3FS_AOuzB12rZGhfuphvRd2_wuzE/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.742ztsc9wg3h
for more detailed mappings discussion between `PrefetchPriority` and
`PrefetchSchedulerPriority` for the future.

There is no behavior change in this CL, since
`PrefetchContainer::priority_` is always `std::nullopt` for now.

Bug: 426404355, 406403063, 406927300

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6654213
Commit-Queue: Taiyo Mizuhashi <taiyo@chromium.org>
Reviewed-by: Ken Okada <kenoss@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477172}

Prefetch: Introduce PrefetchPriority

Design Doc:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ifwra6N4URhs4yD3FS_AOuzB12rZGhfuphvRd2_wuzE

This CL introduces `PrefetchPriority`, which will be an optimization
hint that indicates the relative priority of a prefetch request. A
higher priority suggests that the prefetch caller expects to need
prefetch resources to be available sooner (which is mostly equivalent
with that the prefetch head time is expected to be short).

This CL should have no behavior change. This adds the plumbings from all
triggers, and they all set std::nullopt to
`PrefetchContainer::priority_`, which is unused for this CL.

Also, the name `PrefetchPriority` conflicts with
`PrefetchScheduler::PrefetchPriority`. This CL renames latter to
`PrefetchScheduler::PrefetchSchedulerPriority`

Make crossbench_result_converter support multiple json files.

Crossbench could generate multiple JSON files per browser output,
e.g. `embedder.json`, `chrome_histograms.json`.
The current code expects only one JSON file to be present.

This change fixes the problem by loading all JSON files and merge
their content into single dictionary.

[Blink] Move WebGL resource provider from CRCHost to WebGL context

The only subtle part is ensuring that the resource provider continues to
be reset at every relevant place where DiscardResources() is called.
They are:

* Dispose() [1][2]
* size change [3]
* from within WebGL context itself on detecting a size mismatch [4]
  (note: potentially redundant with [3], but outside the scope of this
   CL)

The other calls are all for other context types.

Reviewed-by: Martin Kreichgauer <martinkr@google.com>
Commit-Queue: Adem Derinel <derinel@google.com>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477140}

DevTools: report raw request headers for cross-origin requests

Previously, to be compatible with HSTS redirect headers reporting,
reporting of cross-origin headers was disabled via the
SetEnableReportingRawHeaders + HasRawHeadersAccess methods. The
HasRawHeadersAccess method is a remnant from the times when network
events would be reported via the renderer, thus, resulting in a security
issue. New architecture sends headers to the DevTools process directly
without sharing it with other renderers.

This CL removes the flag so that raw headers are reported for all
requests if available.

Bug: 352263194
Change-Id: I98283d67f535bd813f7b6aafaee866d24dec1d0e
Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6656825
Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell <blundell@chromium.org>
Reviewed-by: Saifuddin Hitawala <hitawala@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1477137}

Prefetch: Clear no referring origin prefetches on Browsing Data Removal

This CL is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/6311760.

Currently, Browsing Data Removal for a prefetch is performed by
comparing its referring origin, but there could be the case where
referring origin doesn't exist (typically happening on the prefetch
initiated by the browser's decision)

We generally handle no referring origin prefetch as a same-origin
prefetch fashion. Therefore, this CL uses the prefetch's url as a key of
the removal if referring origin doesn't exists, ensuring all prefetches
are properly cleared by Browsing Data Removal.

spanify: Fix rewriting of ptr/raw_ptr to a boolean expr

The old impl rewrote:
    !raw_ptr   ==>  !!raw_span.empty()
    !!raw_ptr  ==>  !!!raw_span.empty()
and
    if (!return_ptr()) {}
    if (!!return_ptr()) {}
to
    if () {.empty()) {}
    if (!) {.empty()) {}
(yes, it was completely broken.)

This patch fixes these broken cases.

Don't try to pool HTTP/2 sessions if a destination requires HTTP/1.1

This CL modifies HttpStreamPoolAttemptManager to avoid reusing an IP
pooled HTTP/2 session if the destination requires HTTP/1.1. This ensures
that HTTP/1.1 is respected even when IP pooling is active.

preload: Fix prerender doesn't work with same urls with different target_hint

Currently, PrerendererImpl::PrerenderInfo doesn't consider target_hint
and only push one prerender at a time in
`PrerendererImpl::ProcessCandidatesForPrerender`. This CL makes
`PrerendererImpl::ProcessCandidatesForPrerender` push one prerender per
target_hint value, and updates the dedup methods in
`PrerendererImpl::MaybePrerender` to avoid deduplicating prerenders with
a same url but different target_hint.

Update binding state before unbinding

Stability.Android.ProcessedCrashCounts has a race issue if a renderer
process is LMK-ed as soon as the process is unbound.

A process being recorded as killed with higher priority binding than
actual makes the metrics unreliable.

We need to update the binding state just after upgrading (i.e. adding)
a binding and just before downgrading (i.e. removing) a binding to
make the metrics reliable.

Prerender: Expand compositor warm-up for some prerender triggers

Currently, compositor warm-up on prerender is only enabled for DUI and
DSE. To expand this optimization to other prerender triggers, this CL
introduces the flags to enable it for each of them:
- BookmarkBar
- NTP
- Immediate SpeculationRules
- Non-Immediate SpeculationRules

All flags are disabled by default, so this CL should have no behavior
changes.

[context menu] adjust anchor if window is drawn edge-to-edge

AnchoredPopupWindow applies anchorRect assuming origin right below the
window decor.
The input touch point from ContextMenuParams are coordinates relative to
the associated RenderView's origin, i.e. the space not including the
window decor, tabstrip and toolbar. It also provides a vertical offset
of height of tabstrip + toolbar which will be added to the touch point
to compute the anchor rect.

This is correct when edge-to-edge is false, e.g. when window decor is
drawn independently from the tab strip (#tab-strip-layout-optimization
is disabled).
But edge-to-edge is true, i.e. window decor is tabstrip, the offset
will cause the anchor rect to be lower than the true touch point by the
height of tabstrip. See:
Before (flag off): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8CMJqYcpPpwBdW8
Before (flag on): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5om8UfsZG4mM3QJ

Therefore, when edge-to-edge is true, subtract from the offset the
height of tabstrip = height of window decor.
After (flag on): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/WCJ2GkgopWu44fQ
After (flag off): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4WqccMYgnXgZj3Z

Guard additional members with locking in ScreenCapture

This CL modifies mNativeDestructionLock to have an additional
responsibility of synchronizing access to members that need to be
accessed on the background thread and the desktop capturer thread. In
upcoming CLs, the members which this CL adds GuardedBy to will need to
be accessed by both threads. For example, when starting capture, the
MediaProjection API can call into MediaProjection.Callback very soon,
even before ScreenCapture#startCapture finishes.

Also, in following CLs to e.g. handle resizing/rotating of the capture,
the code becomes more complex so it's nice to have the locking
programmatically checked.

[soft navs] Fix failing CHECK in metrics uploader

Change to save a reference to the right SoftNavigationContext* when we
decide to measure FCP. This way, we won't accidentally "swap" it for
another context before next paint.

We are sometimes updating the Soft Nav Count more eagerly than we are
sending metrics data, because we update the global value after main
thread paint, while we read the global value after presentation
feedback, and the value might have changed if we navigated again.

When this happens, we increase count by 2+ instead of exactly 1 as
previously expected.

And when that happens, the future update (which we know is coming) will
not have a new value.

Because all the data is accurate an up to date, it seems fine to just
allow this.

However, UkmPLMO does depend on count values changing. I adjusted to fix
the most important use cases, but this issue might lead us to not
resetting INP/CLS. We should followup with more UKM fixes.

deleting cache entries in `SqlPersistentStore`, the storage layer for
the new SQL-based disk cache backend.

The following methods have been added:
- DoomEntry: Marks an entry for deletion by setting a `doomed` flag in
  the database. This logically removes the entry from the cache's size
  and entry count totals but leaves the data on disk until
  `DeleteDoomedEntry` is called.
- DeleteDoomedEntry: Physically removes a previously doomed entry from
  the `resources` table. This action does not alter the cache's size
  metadata, as that was adjusted during the dooming process.
- DeleteLiveEntry: Immediately and physically deletes an live
  (non-doomed) entry. This operation updates the cache size and entry
  count metadata accordingly.

All database modifications are performed within transactions to ensure
atomicity.

Bug: 422065015

Ensure that generated FormControlType values are legitimate

FuzzedDataProvider::ConsumeEnum<FormControlType>() returns values
between 0 and FormControlType::kMaxValue. Because FormControlType has
gaps (e.g. value 12 is not assigned to anything), this leads to invalid
FormControlType. This CL ensures that only valid FormControlType are
generated.

[soft navs] Integrates PaintTimingMixin into SoftNavigation entry.

The soft-navigation entry will now measure and report paint timings,
which is useful as the "first contentful paint" (FCP).

It also has a side benefit: by delaying until after presentation time is
measured, we delay emitting the performance entry to the performance
timeline. This gives Event Timing enough time to report entries (well,
for click and keyboard entries, which is all we support, for now).

This still isn't perfect: the current paint timing isn't necessarily the
"first contentful paint" in the same sense as hard-FCP:

- We delay measuring until after navigationID is incremented-- but this isn't guaranteed to happen in the "first" paint for the Context.  Today, our paint area requirement is so small that it is highly likely to be.  Still, we won't emit LCP until after this point, either.
- We use LCP semantics: ie fully loaded images, because we only check for navigations after "LCP candidates" arrive.  This has additional benefits such as actually checking if the content is visible, but it does delay the timing.  Perhaps a more proper description would be: Hard FCP is "first paint of the first animation frame with any contentful nodes", while Soft FCP is currently "first fully contentful paint" which is also equivalent to first LCP candidate.

In the future soft.FCP might no longer be first soft.LCP candidate, if
we record the first paint before navigation is emitted.

Fix ExtensionBrowserTest::PlatformOpenURLOffTheRecord on desktop Android

Switch the implementation to use the OwningTestTabModel which provides
support for multiple tabs / web contents and counts tabs correctly.
This allows us to eliminate our duplicate TestTabModel.

Use TabAndroid::AttachTabHelpers to attach the various WebContents
user data that a real tab would have. Some extensions tests need
these controllers to exist (see followup CL) for incognito tabs. This
is provided by default on Win/Mac/Linux, so update Android to match.

Revert "[dPWA] Changed logic to show only title in single window scenario."

This reverts commit eccf70d5e1560f0c18614c40523c618a22879759.

Reason for revert: Cause test failures blocking ChromeOS Uprev

Bug: 40790127
Original change's description:
> [dPWA] Changed logic to show only title in single window scenario.
>
> In a single window scenario (PWA only has one window open), the title
> is just the PWA title. If the PWA has multiple windows, the title is
> the prefix-ing behavior. When we have an app open and we open a second
> one, the title of the first window is not changed until navigation.
> One test were also added.

Implement toggle to filter the trivial events in event testing

This CL implements a toggle to enable the filter on
TYPE_WINDOW_CONTENT_CHANGED events in accessibility event testing. The
toggle is passed down to AccessibilityActionAndEventTracker.java to
control the logic to filter out the trivial events. The change is
temporary as the event test flakiness is under investigation. The toggle
ensures the event tests are enabled all time, and it will be removed
once the flakiness of the event tests is solved with trivial events
included.

[crd host] Kill NMHs after host updates

This allows the browser to reload the NMHs. Stale NMHs are problematic
since the mojo protocol could become incompatible with the one that the
host supports.

Rather than listing all NMH processes in the script, I just updated the
pkill pattern to kill all processes with the path starting with the
install dir. We can't kill the service script process, since it would
also kill the desktop session, and systemd wouldn't restart the service.
Conveniently, the script's path starts with /usr/bin/python3, so the
pkill pattern won't kill it.

[soft navs] Introduce a Pre-Paint-based paint attribution mode

Currently, Soft Navigation paint attribution works as follows:
 1. If the DOM update is not "task attributable", do nothing
 2. When a connected DOM node is modified (currently only appended, but
    that will change soon), we add it to a set of nodes to do paint
    attribution for
 3. When painting contentful elements:
   a) (enabled-by-default): Check if the node is in the set for some
      context, and attribute the paint if so
   b) (experimental): Walk up the DOM tree to see if any ancestor is
      in the set, and attribute the paint if so

3(a) is the default, but it is not viable because it's inaccurate (we'd
need to consider disconnected nodes as well, which is too inefficient)

3(b) is more accurate, but there are efficiency concerns due to the
tree walk during paint. This also might limit which input events we can
do attribution for, which limits future metrics.

This CL introduces a new experimental option, which caches the state
needed for determining attribution in a pre-paint tree walk:
 - When the SoftNavigationContext for a node changes, mark a bit on
   LayoutObject indicating that this node has change, and update
   ancestors indicating a descendant has changed. True by default in the
   case the LayoutObject doesn't change (often true for soft navs, due
   to append()).
 - In pre-paint, if a node is being marked as changed, the context for
   the node is determined to either be the parent (if inheriting) or the
   node is a new "container root", with a different context. (tracked by
   SoftNavigationPaintAttributionTracker)
   - If inheriting, a ShouldInheritSoftNavigationContext bit gets set,
     which is used for subsequent walks
   - If not inheriting, the node being visited is a new container root,
     associated with a different context, and that root is passed down
     to children.

Initially, everything is wired up to inherit a null context.

SoftNavigationPaintAttributionTracker maintains a map of (weak) Node to
NodeState, which is the SNC and a couple other bits. To improve memory
efficiency, it only tracks the Nodes it needs to do attribution, which
are:
 - Nodes that were directly modified (e.g. appended, which could be a
   whole subtree)
 - Text aggregation nodes (closest non-anonymous box ancestor of a text
   node), which is what the paint functions see
 - Images (svg, video, images, and background images)

See comments in SoftNavigationPaintAttributionTracker for more details.

Use feature flag in old getAllScreensMedia usage indicators

We are about to replace the old usage indicators for getAllScreensMedia
by a new UX concept. To ensure a smooth transition while, the old usage
indicators should only be shown if the feature for the UX rework isn't
enabled yet. Once this is implemented, the old code can be removed
entirely.

Ash: Fix crash in MahiPanelViewTest.ClickMetrics

The `MahiPanelViewTest.ClickMetrics` test was failing with a `DCHECK`
failure in `AshTestBase::LeftClickOn`. The test attempted to find and
click a view with the ID `kLearnMoreLink`.

This view does not exist, as the "Learn More" link is part of a
`views::StyledLabel` and does not have its own `View` instance or ID, as
shown here
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/system/mahi/mahi_panel_view.cc;l=764;drc=b49c254c612709bbf6efee73667c827613f1876a;bpv=0;bpt=1.
Consequently, `GetViewByID` returned `nullptr`, causing the crash.

This CL fixes the test by:
- Finding the parent `StyledLabel` by its ID (`kFooterLabel`).
- Using `ClickFirstLinkForTesting()` to correctly simulate the link click.
- Removing the now-unused `kLearnMoreLink` from the `ViewId` enum in
  `mahi_constants.h`.
- Re-enabling the test and adding a missing histogram check for
  completeness.

[bedrock] Introduce Browser::DeprecatedCreateOwnedForTesting()

This CL is purely a refactor, there are no behavioral changes.

Currently Browser::Create returns an unowned Browser pointer in
production code, with the Browser ultimately being owned by its
BrowserView / NativeWidget.

However current Browser unittests employ BrowserWindow mocks and
take direct ownership over the Browser returned by Browser::Create().

Browser::DeprecatedCreateOwnedForTesting() is added to make it clear
what the resulting ownership model for the created Browser instance
should be. Currently this is a no-op, but this distinction will
simplify the transition to the new ownership model.

[lensoverlay] Fix not able to select behind CSB

In an ideal world, the searchbox container should be the same size as
what is being rendered to the user. However, this isn't possible,
because the suggestion container is `position: absolute` meaning its
size is not visible to the searchbox container. So instead, disallow
pointer events on the searchbox container, but allow them on the visible
elements to ensure only the parts visible to the user will intercept
event clicks.

De-flake html/browsers/browsing-the-web/history-traversal/event-order/before-load-hash*

The tests assert that, when a hash change occurs before the
load event:
* popstate fires sync
* hashchange fires async, but before the load event

hashchange must be fired from a task queued on the DOM
manipulation task source per
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsing-the-web.html#updating-the-document:hashchangeevent,
but the load event fires due to the completion of HTML parsing,
which is a task from the network task source per
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#read-html.

Therefore, there is no spec guarantee of their relative ordering, and
the test should not require a specific ordering.

only applicable to Chrome-branded Win,Mac,Linux builds. It is not
applicable to ChromeOS, Chromium, CfT and other Chromium builds. So

to determine if we need to disallow these switches in
android-desktop for the long term.

since it does not cause any build issues with the android-desktop
ci tests builder.

Affected test(s):

If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5116756730314752&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F6651876&type=BUG

Original change's description:
> Centralize window title layout logic into BrowserFrame
>
> The `LayoutWebAppWindowTitle` method was previously a virtual function
> on BrowserNonClientFrameView. This led to implementations being
> scattered across various platform-specific subclasses.
>
> This CL consolidates all this platform-specific logic into a single
> method, `BrowserFrame::LayoutWebAppWindowTitle`, using `BUILDFLAG`s to
> differentiate between platforms (Win, Mac, Linux, CrOS).
>
> This refactoring simplifies the `BrowserNonClientFrameView` hierarchy
> and the `BrowserViewLayoutDelegate` interface by removing the
> now-redundant virtual method. Callsites are updated to use the new
> central function.
>

.. that today compiles about_flags.h and flag_description.h

What is more, this new target is added temporarly as part of the
`public_deps` of //c/b:b, not to change the status quo - ie all targets
that today depend on //c/b:b to include these headers will continue to.
However, in a follow up:

  1/ //c/b:flags will be removed from the `public_deps` of //c/b:b, and all
  targets that depend on it will list it explicitly.

In practice, the newly added GN target //c/b:flags also allows the componentization
of .cc files of chrome/browser/ui/toolbar/chrome_labs/, without circular dependencies
against //c/b:b.

Update Throbber start/stop logic to fix race condition.

This cl fixes a race condition where the Throbber's animation timer
could fire after the object was destroyed, which sometimes happened when
the throbber was still active in a dialog during page reloads. This
change replaces it with a WeakPtr to ensure the animation callback is
safely invalidated when the Throbber is destroyed.

Handle owned frame buffers when zero-copy is enabled in MFVEA

When a frame with an owned native storage type is passed to MFVEA which
is backed up by a GPU buffer, the encoder falls back to software
implementation. This fix converts input frame to non-native buffer type
suitable for MFVEA processing.

Only trigger backend call if user is an existing payments customer

Before this change, a backend was made irrespective of whether a user
was a payments customer or not. After this change, we check for the
billing customer number to be nonzero and only then make a backend call

A user who is not a payments customer is automatically eligible for Pix
account linking so we set the eligibility bit to true.

Change-Id: If090ff8208e3903f318c10ec86016764fce0fbfd

Reviewed-by: Xiyuan Xia <xiyuan@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1476769}

[omnibox][toolbelt] Starter pack ranking

Previously: Gemini, bookmarks, history, page, tabs.
This CL moves history before bookmarks.

Before, all except gemini had the same relevance score, and the code
implicitly relied on the service to return template URLs in alphabetical
order. This was fragile, because autocomplete match sorting isn't
stable. It could also be wrong in some locales depending on their
alphabet or their translations of the keywords.

This CL assigns each starter pack a -1 decremented score from the
previous starter pack to ensure correct ranking.

from page_visibility.ts, and can be grabbed directly from there. Passing

Refactor DownloadProtectionDelegate to accommodate async modifications

To accommodate various modifications that DownloadProtectionDelegate
may want to do to the ClientDownloadRequest, currently the delegate
may override PreSerializeRequest() which is called prior to sending
the ClientDownloadRequest in CheckClientDownloadRequestBase.

To make asynchronous modifications possible, this CL modifies the
flow of execution of CheckClientDownloadRequestBase to first solicit a
list of desired modifications from the delegate (as a list of
callbacks), and then kick them all off and apply them to the request
after they all finish.

[WebInstallAPI] Show launch dialog for already-installed background docs

Create new `WebAppLaunchDialog` and `WebAppLaunchDialogDelegate`
- Shows when navigator.install is invoked to install a background document that's already installed. (A new dialog is needed as the intent picker reparents the current web contents, which is unavailable for background doc installs.)
- See design doc [1] page 6 for mockup and more info.
- Dialog architecture is based on existing PWA install dialogs, mainly WebAppSimpleInstallDialog.
-  Dialog creation is initiated by `WebInstallServiceImpl` after it validates that `install_target` belongs to an installed app, as well as that no other installs are happening on the *current* web contents
- For now, dialog only shows app name. #422940463 tracks adding app icon.
- On dialog acceptance, notify the `ServiceImpl` of success and queue a
`LaunchWebAppCommand`. (Note - API promise resolves with kSuccess ONLY
if the user clicked "Open")

Create new `WebAppModalDialogDelegate` and lift shared functionality out
of the existing WebAppInstallDialogDelegate. This is mainly the dialog
behavior on tab switches, occlusion by other UI, etc.

Demo gif - https://issues.chromium.org/333795265#attachment66690990
Feature flag - WebAppInstallation [1]
https://docs.google.com/document/d/167APSoaq-qbcrw6jNn0t01vaB_ZdehIy2JYHnhb-8fk/edit?pli=1&tab=t.0

Fix isolate_tests on ChromeOS after NaCl turndown

browser_tests's data references chromevox_test_data, which is generated
by //third_party/liblouis:liblouis_test_data. However, the data_dep on
//third_party/liblouis:liblouis_test_data is only present when
`enable_nacl` is true: however, `enable_nacl` is never true now.
Unconditionally add this `data_dep` outside the `enable_nacl` block
since browser_tests unconditionally depends on this data directory in
ChromeOS builds.

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson <chrishtr@chromium.org>

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1476710}

Do eglWaitUntilWorkScheduledANGLE for IOSurfaceBackingEGLStateEndAccess when DrDC is enabled

IOSurfaceImageBacking::WaitForCommandsToBeScheduled() which is called
for overlay begin access and it will call
eglWaitUntilWorkScheduledANGLE() which can flush the GL context on the
Viz thread. This should not be done with DrDC enabled. (DrDC on Mac is
enabled only when Graphite is active. |is_thread_safe| is true only when
DrDC is enabled.)

The solution is to call eglWaitUntilWorkScheduledANGLE() instead of
AddEGLDisplayWithPendingCommands() in
IOSurfaceImageBacking::IOSurfaceBackingEGLStateEndAccess()

Centralize window title layout logic into BrowserFrame

The `LayoutWebAppWindowTitle` method was previously a virtual function
on BrowserNonClientFrameView. This led to implementations being
scattered across various platform-specific subclasses.

This CL consolidates all this platform-specific logic into a single
method, `BrowserFrame::LayoutWebAppWindowTitle`, using `BUILDFLAG`s to
differentiate between platforms (Win, Mac, Linux, CrOS).

This refactoring simplifies the `BrowserNonClientFrameView` hierarchy
and the `BrowserViewLayoutDelegate` interface by removing the
now-redundant virtual method. Callsites are updated to use the new
central function.

Add detailed comments to BrowserNonClientFrameView

This change adds comprehensive comments to the BrowserNonClientFrameView
class, its methods, and the related `BrowserFrameActiveState` enum.

This class is a core component for drawing the browser window frame
(title bar, borders, etc.), but many of its functions and concepts were
sparsely documented. The new comments clarify the purpose of the class,
the responsibilities of its key methods, and the meaning of its public
API.

This is a documentation-only change with no functional modifications.

[iOS] Add Feature Engagement event for First Run completion

This change introduces a new Feature Engagement event,
kIOSFirstRunComplete, to signal the completion of the First Run
Experience (FRE).

This is a preparatory change that will enable a subsequent refactor to
prevent "new" badge collisions for In-Product Help (IPH) on the
homepage. For more info, please see: crbug.com/422106010

By firing this event, we can ensure that "new" badges for features like
the Lens entrypoint and Homepage Customization are not displayed shortly
after a user completes the FRE.

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1476675}

Re-introduce DWM Backdrop instead of WUC

Since enabling RemoveRedirectionBitmap, we have received reports of
startup jank due to the loading of the CoreMessaging dll for the WUC
backdrop. In crrev.com/c/6489643 a tradeoff was made to block the main
thread to load the library. The benefit of this approach was that there
would be no transparent backdrop while the library was loading
asynchronously.

However, startup janks yield a poor UX and generate user churn.
Therefore, this change re-introduces the DWM backdrop and changes the
redirection bitmap flag to be enabled only for devices that support

a11y: Limit text styling spans to accessibility focus

This change limits the fetching of text styling data when the node has
accessibility focus, to limit the performance impact when generating
AccessibilityNodeInfo objects.

Also, this fixes getting the accessibility focus node by fetching it
from the Java side.

In addition, we clear the node cache in Java when the accessibility
focus changes, so that stale cached node texts that don't have styling
data can be repopulated.

Support the SPC testdriver API in the new UX flow on Android

This CL implements the SPC testdriver API for the new UX flow on
Android. It does not yet include the new AUTOAUTHANOTHERWAY mode that
was added to the spec - that will come in a later CL.

Note that supporting the testdriver API on Android will not actually let
most SPC WPTs run there, because we also rely on WebAuthn's virtual
authenticator concept which doesn't exist on Android. However it is
useful to do this for correctness at least, as well as to guard against
a future where WebAuthn supports their own testdriver API on Android.

Bug: 417426346
Change-Id: I53645f33d885f44c049942e8453b164f2b1f9dfc
Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6655380
Reviewed-by: Darwin Yang <darwinyang@chromium.org>
Commit-Queue: Stephen McGruer <smcgruer@chromium.org>
Reviewed-by: Kavita Soni <kavitasoni@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1476661}

[soft navs] Include image element src changes as DOM modifications

This CL changes soft nav detection so that changing the src attribute of
an HTMLImageElement --- as well as other attributes that cause an
image to be updated, e.g. src for <input type=image> or the poster
attribute for videos --- causes (future paints of) the node to be
tracked by soft nav heuristics. This is accomplished by:

 1. Moving the ContainerNode soft-nav checks into
    SoftNavigationHeuristics so we don't duplicate things, which is
    nice on its own to move decision making into SNH.
 2. Informing SNH of the attribute change, which we can do centrally in
    ImageLoader.

For now, this just reuses the ModifiedDOM() method to wire things up,
but we might want to add "cause" or something to add to tracing, which
can be done as a follow-up. We'll probably also want to consider other
attributes, but this is a starting point.

Bug: 328783345

Reviewed-by: Michal Mocny <mmocny@chromium.org>
Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1476660}

[Bedrock] Move ExclusiveAccessManager to BrowserWindowFeatures

This CL moves ExclusiveAccessManager off Browser and into
BrowserWindowFeatures.

Some other code related to DownloadBubbleUIController initialization
was moved into BrowserWindowFeatures::InitPostWindowConstruction, just
after ExclusiveAccessManager creation, because it needed
ExclusiveAccessManager to be initialized to get FullScreenController
that it depended on. Also bypassed DownloadBubbleUIController and
directly used download_toolbar_ui_controller_->display_controller().

ExclusiveAccessManager was initialized early in BrowserWindowFeatures::
InitPostWindowConstruction because LensOverlayEntryPointController::
Initialize also needed FullScreenController initialization to be done
by ExclusiveAccessManager.

The remaining changes involved mostly about adding
browser_window_features.h header to most source files and adding
//chrome/browser/ui/browser_window as dependency in the corresponding
BUILD.gn files.

[ScrollPrediction] Deleted time-based scroll prediction.

2 prediction approaches were originally added as experiments: Time-based
and frames-based. We're no longer going to pursue the time-based
approach as it doesn't make sense to choose a fixed prediction time.
Prediction should always be a function of the frame interval and as
such, we'll only be keeping the frame-based approach. This is more of a
code clean up and won't affect the current scroll prediction improvement
efforts.

[Watermark 2.0] Align watermark text to top

This change sets the vertical alignment of the watermark's RenderText to
ALIGN_TOP. This makes the text's top edge aligned with that of its
display area

As a result, the min_y calculation, which previously added a font_size
offset to ensure the watermark is shown correctly, can now be simplified
to return 0. This makes the coordinate system more intuitive for drawing
watermark blocks.

DOMStorage: Improve Local & Session Storage ShutDown and destruction

Local or Session Storage ShutDown can result in asynchronous work. With
the code landed in this CL: crrev.com/c/6572332 , this can lead to their
destructor running before the ShutDown is complete. This change prevents
that issue by delegating Storage ShutDown to the StorageServiceImpl that
owns instances of Local and Session Storage.

StorageServiceImpl in turn transfers ownership of storages to a
DeferredDeleter as part of running ShutDown. This allows the storages to
be correctly destructed after their ShutDown completes.

Reland "[Settings][DBD] Add a signout link to settings checkbox sublabel"

This is a reland of commit f795fd2f532d5139daef2bb628810c807d4bbe58

Reason for reland: Cause of the revert was a DCHECK thrown because the
#labelContainer element, which has a prohibited role "GenericContainer",
was setting an aria-label in some contexts.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/signin/signout_confirmation/extensions_section.html.ts;l=14

Prior to this change the #labelContainer had aria-hidden set to true, so
the screen readers ignored that element. The fix for this is to move the
aria-label from the #labelContainer to the checkbox element. This allows
us to remove the aria-hidden attribute from #labelContainer but also
allow ariaLabelOverride to work without hitting the CHECKs.

Original change's description:
> [Settings][DBD] Add a signout link to settings checkbox sublabel
>
> This change adds a signout link to the 'Cookies and site data' checkbox
> in the 'Delete browsing data' settings page (On non-ChromeOS platforms).
> The string that contains the linkout is constructed on the C++ side and
> displayed in the dialog once 'browsing-data-counter-text-update' is
> called with the corresponding pref.
>
> To allow for anchor elements with custom click behaviors in the
> settings-checkbox element. This change also propagates valid click
> events from `subLabelHtml` outside of the 'settings-checkbox' element by
> firing a 'sub-label-link-clicked' event, this gives clients the
> flexibility with handling the events accordingly.
>
> This does mean that the default behavior of an anchor element (opening a
> link), will not work if the clients do not handle the
> 'sub-label-link-clicked' event. However, this does not break any
> existing behavior as the only client of the `subLabelHtml` attribute is
> `settings-clear-browsing-data-dialog` which does not pass any action
> links.
>
> Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9ovXw3zcFaouWZ7
